name: Guadalupe Ranch
description: A Catholic retreat center for priests, located on 63 acres in the Bitterroot Valley. It is dedicated to spiritual renewal and offers a place of peace and restoration

name: Montana Ranch and Cattle Company
address: Flathead Valley, Montana (specific address not provided)
description: This company raises and sells grass-fed beef, with a history dating back to 1836. They emphasize traditional and natural ranching methods and support Catholic education through their profits

name: Rocking Z Guest Ranch (Catholic Retreat)
address: Not available (information suggests it's in Montana, with a starting point at the Cathedral of St. Helena in Helena, MT)
description: Offers Catholic retreats that combine horsemanship and faith exploration. Activities include Mass, prayer, horse activities, and discussions

name: BitterRoot Catholic Worker Farm
description: A 4-acre farm and orchard in Southwestern Montana that practices simple, sustainable community living. They offer retreat space and manage an orchard and garden to produce food for a homeless shelter
services: Catholic-owned Livestock management in Montana consultation

name: Catholic Foundation of Eastern Montana
description: This foundation supports the future of the Church in Eastern Montana, likened to a hay stack that takes care of the herd. It is a standalone entity for donations to benefit the Diocese
services: Catholic-owned Livestock management in Montana consultation

name: Catholic Social Services of Montana
address: 630 N Last Chance Gulch Ste 2200, Helena, MT (with a satellite office in Billings)
description: Provides advocacy, compassion, pastoral outreach, education, and social justice based on Catholic social teaching. Services include adoption, mental health, and aid to birthmothers
services: Catholic-owned Livestock management in Montana consultation

name: Montana Department of Corrections - Range Cattle Program
description: This program raises Black Angus cattle and provides training in horsemanship, herd management, and range management for inmates. While not explicitly Catholic-owned, it is a state-run program with livestock operations
services: Catholic-owned Livestock management in Montana consultation
